Question: What is the name of your VxRail HCI deployment project?
Guidance: Provide internal project reference name

Question: Who is the primary stakeholder for this HCI infrastructure project?
Guidance: Name, role, and decision-making authority
Notes: Main point of contact and decision authority

Question: What infrastructure challenges are you trying to solve with hyperconverged infrastructure?
Guidance: Common challenges: Aging hardware refresh, Complex SAN management, Slow VM provisioning, High infrastructure costs, Disaster recovery complexity, Data center footprint
Notes: Primary business driver for HCI investment

Question: What is your current virtualization and storage infrastructure?
Guidance: Describe hypervisor, SAN/NAS storage, server count, and pain points

Question: How many virtual machines do you currently run in production?
Notes: Determines cluster sizing and capacity planning

Question: What types of workloads will you run on VxRail?
Guidance: Common types: Windows Server, Linux servers, SQL Server databases, Oracle databases, Application servers, Virtual desktops (VDI), Development/test environments

Question: What are your primary goals for deploying hyperconverged infrastructure?
Guidance: Common goals: Simplify infrastructure management, Reduce data center footprint, Accelerate VM provisioning, Improve disaster recovery, Lower total cost of ownership, Eliminate vendor finger-pointing

Question: How will you measure VxRail HCI deployment success?
Guidance: Define KPIs: VM deployment time reduction, infrastructure cost savings, admin hours saved, rack space reduction, mean time to resolution

Question: What is your expected timeline for VxRail HCI deployment?
Guidance: Typical ranges: 0-3 months, 3-6 months, 6-12 months, 12+ months
Notes: Project timeline expectations and hardware refresh urgency

Question: What is your approved budget range for HCI infrastructure?
Guidance: Common ranges: $200K-$500K (4-node), $500K-$1M (8-node), $1M-$2M (12-16 node), $2M+. Include both CapEx and OpEx

Question: What is your long-term vision for data center infrastructure?
Guidance: Consider multi-site deployments, hybrid cloud integration, expansion to additional clusters

Question: How do you expect VM count and storage capacity to change over 3 years?
Guidance: Provide current capacity and projected annual growth rate

Question: What hypervisor do you currently use?
Guidance: Options: VMware ESXi, Microsoft Hyper-V, KVM/RHEV, Citrix XenServer, Mixed environment

Question: Do you have existing VMware licensing (vSphere
Guidance: vSAN
Notes: Specify licenses and versions if applicable. May reduce costs if portable to VxRail

Question: What VMware version requirements do you have?
Guidance: VxRail ships with vSphere 8 and vSAN 8. Legacy app compatibility may require specific versions

Question: What is your total usable storage capacity requirement?
Guidance: Include current usage plus 3-year growth. Common ranges: 20-50TB, 50-100TB, 100-200TB, 200TB+
Notes: vSAN capacity sizing (account for FTT overhead)

Question: What storage IOPS performance do you require?
Guidance: Specify current IOPS or workload needs. All-flash vs hybrid configuration
Notes: Storage tier selection and performance validation

Question: What storage performance tier do you need?
Guidance: Options: All-flash (high performance/low latency), Hybrid (cost-optimized with SSD cache + HDD capacity)
Notes: Cost vs performance tradeoff for vSAN configuration

Question: Do you need storage deduplication and compression?
Guidance: vSAN Enterprise includes dedup/compression (typically 2-3:1 ratio for VMs)
Notes: Capacity optimization and effective storage calculation

Question: What total CPU core count and vCPU capacity do you need?
Guidance: Calculate current VM vCPU allocation plus growth. VxRail E560: 32 cores per node
Notes: CPU sizing and VM density planning

Question: What total RAM capacity is required for your VMs?
Guidance: Calculate current VM memory allocation plus growth. VxRail E560: 768GB per node standard
Notes: Memory sizing and VM density planning

Question: What is your target VM density per host?
Guidance: Typical ranges: 20-40 VMs/host (small VMs), 40-60 VMs/host (medium), 10-20 VMs/host (large database VMs)
Notes: Host resource allocation and HA planning

Question: What network connectivity is available in your data center?
Guidance: VxRail requires minimum 10GbE for vSAN. 25GbE recommended for optimal performance

Question: What network redundancy and bandwidth do you require?
Guidance: VxRail uses multiple 10/25GbE links per node for vSAN, vMotion, and management
Notes: Network fabric design and ToR switch sizing

Question: What VLAN segmentation is required?
Guidance: Common: Management, vMotion, vSAN, VM production networks. Minimum 4 VLANs
Notes: Network design and switch port configuration

Question: Do you need to integrate with existing SAN/NAS storage?
Guidance: VxRail uses vSAN internal storage. External storage for legacy apps or backup targets

Question: What backup solution do you use or plan to use?
Guidance: Common: Veeam, Dell EMC PowerProtect Data Manager (PPDM), Commvault, Rubrik, Cohesity

Question: Where will backup data be stored?
Guidance: Options: VxRail internal (not recommended for production), External NAS, Tape library, Cloud (AWS S3, Azure Blob), Dell Data Domain

Question: Do you have an existing vCenter Server or need new deployment?
Guidance: VxRail can integrate with existing vCenter or deploy dedicated vCenter

Question: Do you need Active Directory integration for authentication?
Guidance: vCenter and ESXi host authentication via AD for centralized user management

Question: What infrastructure monitoring tools do you currently use?
Guidance: Common: VMware vRealize Operations, vROps, SolarWinds, Nagios, Prometheus/Grafana, PRTG

Question: Do you use infrastructure automation or orchestration tools?
Guidance: Tools: Ansible, Terraform, VMware vRealize Automation, PowerCLI scripts

Question: What uptime SLA do you require for VxRail cluster?
Guidance: Common targets: 99% (3.65 days downtime/year), 99.9% (8.76 hours/year), 99.99% (52 minutes/year)

Question: What level of hardware failure tolerance do you need?
Guidance: Options: FTT=1 (tolerate 1 node failure), FTT=2 (tolerate 2 node failures). Requires minimum 4 or 6 nodes respectively
Notes: vSAN failure tolerance policy and cluster sizing

Question: How will you handle planned maintenance and firmware updates?
Guidance: VxRail Lifecycle Manager automates rolling updates with zero downtime

Question: Do you need disaster recovery to a second site?
Guidance: Options: VMware Site Recovery Manager (SRM), vSAN stretched cluster, Async replication

Question: What are your Recovery Time Objective (RTO) and Recovery Point Objective (RPO)?
Guidance: RTO: Maximum acceptable downtime, RPO: Maximum acceptable data loss (minutes/hours)
Notes: DR solution selection and replication strategy

Question: Do you have multiple data centers for geographic redundancy?
Guidance: Stretched cluster requires < 5ms RTT latency between sites

Question: Do you need VM replication for disaster recovery?
Guidance: Options: vSphere Replication (VM-level), vSAN replication (array-level), Third-party (Zerto)

Question: What is the highest data classification level on VxRail infrastructure?
Guidance: Levels: Public, Internal, Confidential, Restricted, PII/PHI
Notes: Determines encryption and access control requirements

Question: Do you require encryption at rest for VM storage?
Guidance: vSAN encryption available with external Key Management Server (KMS)

Question: What key management solution will you use for vSAN encryption?
Guidance: Options: VMware vCenter Native KMS, HashiCorp Vault, Thales CipherTrust, AWS KMS (hybrid)

Question: What compliance standards must the VxRail infrastructure meet?
Guidance: Common standards: SOC 2, ISO 27001, HIPAA, PCI DSS, FedRAMP, NIST, GDPR

Question: What network segmentation and firewall rules are required?
Guidance: Micro-segmentation with NSX-T for VM-level firewall policies

Question: What authentication and authorization requirements apply?
Guidance: Options: Local vCenter accounts, Active Directory/LDAP, SSO (SAML), MFA, Certificate-based

Question: What audit and logging requirements do you have?
Guidance: Requirements: vCenter audit logs, ESXi shell access logs, vSAN health logs, Configuration change tracking
Notes: Audit trail and compliance reporting needs

Question: What security patching and vulnerability management processes apply?
Guidance: VxRail Lifecycle Manager automates patching across entire stack (ESXi, vCenter, firmware)

Question: Do you require UEFI Secure Boot and TPM for host security?
Guidance: VxRail supports Secure Boot and TPM 2.0 for trusted boot chain

Question: Do you need workload isolation between different security zones?
Guidance: Options: Separate clusters, Resource pools with reservations, NSX micro-segmentation

Question: Where will the VxRail cluster be physically located?
Guidance: Options: On-premises data center, Colocation facility, Edge location

Question: How much rack space is available for VxRail deployment?
Guidance: VxRail E560: 2U per node. 4-node cluster = 8U (plus 2U for switches). Plan for cable management
Notes: Rack capacity and physical layout planning

Question: What power and cooling capacity is available?
Guidance: VxRail E560 node: ~800W max. 4-node cluster ~3.2kW. Ensure adequate PDU circuits and HVAC

Question: What VxRail form factor is preferred?
Guidance: Options: E560 (2U rack-mount), P570 (1U high-density), D560 (desktop for ROBO)
Notes: Physical configuration based on deployment location

Question: What Dell support coverage do you require?
Guidance: Options: ProSupport (next business day), ProSupport Plus (4-hour response), Mission Critical (2-hour response 24x7)

Question: What support hours do you need?
Guidance: Options: Business hours (8x5), Extended hours (24x5), 24x7 coverage

Question: What monitoring and alerting is required for VxRail?
Guidance: VxRail Manager provides health monitoring. Integration with vRealize Operations or third-party tools

Question: Who will administer the VxRail infrastructure?
Guidance: Identify VMware and storage admin resources. Training needs assessment

Question: Do you need operational runbooks and documentation?
Guidance: Standard operating procedures for VxRail management and troubleshooting

Question: What change control processes apply to VxRail?
Guidance: VxRail Lifecycle Manager simplifies updates. Define approval workflow and maintenance windows

Question: Who will be the technical lead for this VxRail HCI project?
Guidance: Name, role, contact information

Question: What internal resources are available for VxRail deployment?
Guidance: List team members, roles, and time commitment (hours per week)
Notes: Resource planning and project timeline feasibility

Question: What is your team's experience with VMware vSphere and vSAN?
Guidance: Experience levels: No experience, Basic, Intermediate, Advanced (VCP certified), Expert (VCDX)
Notes: Training needs assessment and knowledge transfer

Question: What is your preferred migration approach from existing infrastructure?
Guidance: Options: Phased migration by application, Pilot workloads first, Parallel run, Big bang cutover

Question: How will you migrate VMs to VxRail?
Guidance: Options: vMotion (VMware to VMware), Cold migration (shutdown), V2V conversion (Hyper-V to VMware), Fresh install

Question: What maintenance windows are acceptable for migration?
Guidance: Specify days/times and maximum downtime per application

Question: What training will be needed for VxRail administrators?
Guidance: Types: VxRail Administration (2 days), vSphere fundamentals, vSAN specialist, Lifecycle Manager

Question: What validation testing is required before production go-live?
Guidance: Examples: Performance benchmarks, Failover testing, Backup/restore validation, Application compatibility

Question: Do you need Dell ProDeploy services for installation?
Guidance: ProDeploy includes rack installation, network configuration, and basic setup
Notes: Dell professional services and on-site support

Question: What is your go-live criteria for VxRail production use?
Guidance: Examples: All VMs migrated, Monitoring operational, Backup tested, Team trained, Runbooks delivered

Question: What dependencies exist on legacy infrastructure?
Guidance: Identify applications that cannot easily migrate (physical servers, legacy storage arrays)

Question: What concerns do you have about VMware or Dell dependency?
Guidance: VxRail is VMware-only. vSAN ties to vSphere. Consider long-term platform commitment

Question: What happens if you exceed initial VxRail cluster capacity?
Guidance: Can add nodes incrementally up to 64-node cluster. Plan for expansion budget

Question: What is your tolerance for cluster-wide failures?
Guidance: All VMs on single cluster share fate. Multiple clusters for isolation or DR cluster for redundancy
Notes: Failure mode analysis and redundancy strategy

Question: What concerns do you have about network performance?
Guidance: vSAN requires high network bandwidth. Insufficient network = performance degradation
Notes: Network capacity planning and bottleneck avoidance

Question: What is your biggest concern about managing VxRail?
Guidance: Common: VMware administration learning curve, vSAN troubleshooting, Lifecycle management complexity
Notes: Skill development and external support requirements

Question: What could cause the migration to VxRail to fail?
Guidance: Consider: application compatibility, insufficient capacity planning, network issues, data migration complexity

Question: What constraints must the solution work within?
Guidance: Consider: CapEx limits, OpEx annual budget (support), Approval processes, Procurement timelines
Notes: Solution design boundaries and financial constraints

Question: What are your current annual infrastructure costs?
Guidance: Include server maintenance, SAN support, power/cooling, rack space, admin labor
Notes: ROI baseline for cost comparison analysis

Question: How much will you save by decommissioning legacy infrastructure?
Guidance: Calculate maintenance contracts, power consumption, rack rental for retired equipment

Question: How much admin time will VxRail save vs current infrastructure?
Guidance: HCI simplifies management (single pane of glass vs separate SAN/server tools). Estimate hours saved/week
Notes: Operational efficiency and labor cost reduction

Question: What ROI timeline and payback period are you targeting?
Guidance: VxRail TCO benefits accrue over 3-5 years (CapEx vs OpEx tradeoff). Typical payback 18-24 months

Question: Do you prefer CapEx purchase or OpEx leasing?
Guidance: Dell Financial Services offers leasing to convert CapEx to OpEx. Consider budget approval processes
